<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good snowy morning. </strong>We must begin today’s newsletter with a shoutout to the Brew U team at the University of Washington. This fine crew of Huskies won our college ambassador competition for getting the most new Brew readers last semester. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re the kind of college student who gets up before 11am even if you don’t have to and wants to spread the Brew around your campus, stay tuned: We’ll be announcing the spring semester of the Brew U program in January.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/16/second-stimulus-measure-reportedly-back-table-finally-happen?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Stimulus Package Is Out for Delivery
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A receipt coming out of the U.S. Capitol building " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDUyL3N0aW11bHVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday’s news felt like that moment where you think you spot someone who looks exactly like a celebrity. But, was Sophie Turner actually browsing for produce at Safeway?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sophie Turner = a second stimulus package. After about half-a-year of playing chicken, U.S. lawmakers appear to be on the <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/16/politics/stimulus-negotiations-state-of-play/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">precipice</a> of a follow-up to the CARES Act. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s in the most delayed sequel since <em>Top Gun: Maverick</em>
</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/12/16/congress-stimulus-checks-relief/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>, the proposal totals about $900 billion and includes funding for: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another round of direct payment checks of about $600–$700 for people earning under a certain income threshold </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Continuation of the Paycheck Protection Program for small businesses (we </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/warren-buffett-david-solomon-urge-congress-extend-ppp-small-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote about this</a></span><span> yesterday)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Supplemental federal unemployment benefits </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Vaccine distribution and schools </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s reportedly not in the current plan:</strong> aid for states and local governments and liability protection for businesses. Democrats wanted the former, while Republicans pushed for the latter. In a classic D.C. compromise, they dropped both. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check:</strong> The help can’t come soon enough. A recent report found that about 8 million Americans have fallen into poverty since the summer. Plus, the pandemic is resurgent in many areas, compounding the economic crisis, and several aid programs will expire at the end of the year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also...the government will run out of money at midnight on Friday without a spending bill. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fed Chair Jerome Powell <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/16/fed-decision-december-2020-fed-commits-to-keep-buying-bonds-until-the-economy-gets-back-to-full-employment.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is trying</a> to do his part to juice the economy. At the conclusion of the Fed's two-day meeting, the central bank said it will keep interest rates near zero and keep buying bonds until the U.S. reaches full employment and inflation settles at 2%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the House could vote on the stimulus bill today, followed by the Senate tomorrow if all of its members are on board. But if there are any snags, votes could spill into the weekend. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/16/texas-attorney-general-leads-antitrust-suit-google-focusing-ad-business?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Slap a Wrist Enough Times, It Starts to Hurt
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simpsons cop saying "Just don't do it again, you big lug." " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=514 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oriffhhxhmuQP2Xgk/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simpsons cop saying " Just don't do it again, you big lug." " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oriffhhxhmuQP2Xgk/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While 2020 encouraged many people to experiment with new hobbies, like chess or screaming into the void, the nation's top legal officials have settled on their preferred leisure activity: suing Big Tech. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a group of state attorneys general led by Texas <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/doj-antitrust-lawsuit-against-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> they're taking legal action against Google for, you guessed it, engaging in anticompetitive practices. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The suit claims that Google is the Joey Chestnut to the digital advertising industry's plate of hot dogs. It alleges Google’s size allows it to</span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/texas-hits-google-with-antitrust-suit-8bf73ca7-873f-4fa4-b70d-d6894c1c72c5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> dominate the marketplace</a></span><span> and get up to all sorts of antitrust-y shenanigans, like rigging ad auctions and artificially driving up prices. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>If this feels like déjà sue, you’d be correct. The Justice Department has also filed a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/doj-antitrust-lawsuit-against-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">separate complaint</a> against Google for elbowing out search rivals and abusing its position as “the gateway to the internet,” according to U.S. Deputy Attorney General Jeffrey Rosen.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Shares of Google’s parent company Alphabet—which indicate whether investors think these allegations will actually threaten Google's business prospects—were down <a href="https://www.google.com/search?q=google+shares&rlz=1C5CHFA_enUS897US897&oq=google+shares&aqs=chrome..69i57j0i433i457j0j0i433j0j69i60l3.1611j0j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">less than 1%</a> following the news.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/16/us-labels-vietnam-switzerland-currency-manipulators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Two Three Four I Declare a Currency War
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the first time in its history, Switzerland made someone angry. Yesterday, the U.S. Treasury labeled the European country and Vietnam <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-global-trade-vietnam-china-switzerland-ac44b57c4e4f5ab7019d382a7cffc025?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">currency manipulators</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is currency manipulation?</strong> It’s when governments try to tilt the winds of trade in their favor by illegally tinkering with their currency. By slapping the label on Switzerland and Vietnam, the U.S. can apply a broad variety of punishments, including tariffs—but they’ll try to talk out their differences before it comes to that. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The case of Vietnam</strong></span><span>: The U.S. thinks Vietnam’s currency, the dong, is undervalued, making its exports more attractive than American products.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The case of Switzerland:</strong></span><span> The Swiss franc is considered a safe-haven for investors, so it </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/9bcd4d84-fdec-4f03-9560-dc58f2721899?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tends to rise</a></span><span> when economic conditions go south. But the Swiss government doesn't want it to rise too much. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters:</strong> Labeling countries as currency manipulators is <a href="https://www.axios.com/switzerand-vietnam-currency-manipulators-b890e346-ab0f-4fdd-91f8-920674fca45a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rarer</a> than a Federer two-handed backhand, and it reflects the tougher trade stance taken by the Trump administration toward both allies and rivals. Expect incoming President-elect Joe Biden to adopt a softer tone. </p>

<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Massachusetts securities regulators <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/massachusetts-regulators-to-file-complaint-against-robinhood-11608120003?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed a complaint</a> against the popular stock trading platform Robinhood for prioritizing “its revenue over the best interest of its customers,” according to documents reviewed by the WSJ.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The deets:</strong> Regulators argue that Robinhood exposes its customers to “unnecessary trading risks.” Robinhood says its app has “opened up financial markets for a new generation of people who were previously excluded.” They both might be right. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Robinhood’s easy-to-navigate platform has attracted over 13 million insanely active traders. In June, it processed 4.3 million daily average revenue trades, more than every other brokerage </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/10/robinhood-reports-more-monthly-trades-than-rivals-charles-schwab-e-trade-combined.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">combined</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the complaint from Massachusetts says that’s exactly the problem. It claims that Robinhood gamifies trading in a way that “encourages customers to use the platform constantly,” without properly conveying the risks associated with betting your net worth on Virgin Galactic call options.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Robinhood, currently valued at $12 billion, is reportedly <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/12/08/robinhood-hires-goldman-sachs-to-lead-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eyeing an IPO</a> in 2021. This MAction could be a sign of legal thumb wars to come. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/16/japanese-appliance-startup-pops-88-public-market-debut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Had to Kiss an Appliance
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="a Balmuda toaster" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDQ5L2JhbG11ZGFfdG9hc3Rlci5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Balmuda</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You could definitely do worse than that sleek toaster from Japanese startup Balmuda, which <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-balmuda-ipo-idUSKBN28Q0DQ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a> on Tokyo’s Mothers exchange yesterday. Shares popped 88% thanks to a flood of enthusiasm from retail investors.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Just like in the states, the number of individual investors in Japan has </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/07b2c61b-9d04-459d-8ca0-c509cd636123?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ballooned</a></span><span> during the pandemic as people look for ways to fill time that aren’t sourdough or Netflix. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> Balmuda is a small player that offers premium alternatives to the products churned out by Japan’s consumer electronics giants such as Toshiba and Panasonic. That sexy little oven above will set you back $224, and Balmuda’s “The Gohan” rice cooker costs $400. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The toaster isn’t just a pretty face—users </span><span><a href="https://www.vogue.com/article/balmuda-toaster?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have said</a></span><span> it heats snacks to crispy-on-the-outside, moist-on-the-inside perfection. It comes with a little teaspoon of water, which helps seal in moisture. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>There wasn't a market for high-end toasters until Balmuda showed what was possible. </p>

CORRECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Messed Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, we incorrectly wrote that if confirmed as Transportation Secretary, Pete Buttigieg would become the first openly LGBTQ Cabinet secretary. He would actually become the first LGBTQ person <em>confirmed</em> <em>by the Senate</em> to a Cabinet-level position. Richard Grenell, President Trump’s former acting director of national intelligence, was the first openly gay leader of a Cabinet-level agency.</p>
</td>

</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If there’s one thing we’ve learned from the newsletter biz it's that there are some truly crazy news stories out there. We’ve assembled three of the weirdest headlines we came across this week...but slipped in one we made up to keep your B.S. sensors sharp. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“City of Paris is fined 90,000 Euros for naming </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/12/15/946905346/city-of-paris-is-fined-90-000-euros-for-naming-too-many-women-to-senior-position?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20201216&utm_term=5033944&utm_campaign=news&utm_id=46082882&orgid=305&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">too many women</a></span><span> to senior positions”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Japan opens </span><span><a href="https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/japan-coronavirus-drive-thru-strawberry-picking/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">drive-thru</a></span><span> strawberry picking as coronavirus continues to redefine norms”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“‘Vaccine Santa Claus’ wanted by authorities after peddling fake </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/37nIF1xFGsGF8TZSHx/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">peppermint-flavored vaccines</a></span><span> to viewers on TikTok”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Man is jailed after taking jet ski </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/15/world/europe/jet-ski-isle-of-man-dale-mclaughlan.html?surface=most-popular&fellback=false&req_id=879880629&algo=bandit-all-surfaces-30min&variant=3_bandit-all-surfaces-30min_daysback_4&imp_id=353551722&action=click&module=Most%20Popular&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">across Irish Sea</a></span><span><span> to see girlfriend”</span></span><span>
</span>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday’s news felt like that moment where you think you spot someone who looks exactly like a celebrity. But, was Sophie Turner actually browsing for produce at Safeway?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSophie Turner = a second stimulus package. After about half-a-year of playing chicken, U.S. lawmakers appear to be on the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/16/politics/stimulus-negotiations-state-of-play/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprecipice\u003c/a\u003e of a follow-up to the CARES Act. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s in the most delayed sequel since \u003cem\u003eTop Gun: Maverick\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/12/16/congress-stimulus-checks-relief/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e, the proposal totals about $900 billion and includes funding for: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnother round of direct payment checks of about $600–$700 for people earning under a certain income threshold \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eContinuation of the Paycheck Protection Program for small businesses (we \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/warren-buffett-david-solomon-urge-congress-extend-ppp-small-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote about this\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSupplemental federal unemployment benefits \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eVaccine distribution and schools \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s reportedly not in the current plan:\u003c/strong\u003e aid for states and local governments and liability protection for businesses. Democrats wanted the former, while Republicans pushed for the latter. In a classic D.C. compromise, they dropped both. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check:\u003c/strong\u003e The help can’t come soon enough. A recent report found that about 8 million Americans have fallen into poverty since the summer. Plus, the pandemic is resurgent in many areas, compounding the economic crisis, and several aid programs will expire at the end of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlso...the government will run out of money at midnight on Friday without a spending bill. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFed Chair Jerome Powell \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/16/fed-decision-december-2020-fed-commits-to-keep-buying-bonds-until-the-economy-gets-back-to-full-employment.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis trying\u003c/a\u003e to do his part to juice the economy. At the conclusion of the Fed's two-day meeting, the central bank said it will keep interest rates near zero and keep buying bonds until the U.S. reaches full employment and inflation settles at 2%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe House could vote on the stimulus bill today, followed by the Senate tomorrow if all of its members are on board. It alleges Google’s size allows it to\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/texas-hits-google-with-antitrust-suit-8bf73ca7-873f-4fa4-b70d-d6894c1c72c5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e dominate the marketplace\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and get up to all sorts of antitrust-y shenanigans, like rigging ad auctions and artificially driving up prices. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIf this feels like déjà sue, you’d be correct. The Justice Department has also filed a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/doj-antitrust-lawsuit-against-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseparate complaint\u003c/a\u003e against Google for elbowing out search rivals and abusing its position as “the gateway to the internet,” according to U.S. Deputy Attorney General Jeffrey Rosen.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nOne Two Three Four I Declare a Currency War\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the first time in its history, Switzerland made someone angry. Yesterday, the U.S. Treasury labeled the European country and Vietnam \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-global-trade-vietnam-china-switzerland-ac44b57c4e4f5ab7019d382a7cffc025?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecurrency manipulators\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is currency manipulation?\u003c/strong\u003e It’s when governments try to tilt the winds of trade in their favor by illegally tinkering with their currency. By slapping the label on Switzerland and Vietnam, the U.S. can apply a broad variety of punishments, including tariffs—but they’ll try to talk out their differences before it comes to that. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case of Vietnam\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: The U.S. thinks Vietnam’s currency, the dong, is undervalued, making its exports more attractive than American products.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case of Switzerland:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The Swiss franc is considered a safe-haven for investors, so it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/9bcd4d84-fdec-4f03-9560-dc58f2721899?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etends to rise\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e when economic conditions go south. But the Swiss government doesn't want it to rise too much. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters:\u003c/strong\u003e Labeling countries as currency manipulators is \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/switzerand-vietnam-currency-manipulators-b890e346-ab0f-4fdd-91f8-920674fca45a.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erarer\u003c/a\u003e than a Federer two-handed backhand, and it reflects the tougher trade stance taken by the Trump administration toward both allies and rivals. Expect incoming President-elect Joe Biden to adopt a softer tone. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Massachusetts securities regulators \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/massachusetts-regulators-to-file-complaint-against-robinhood-11608120003?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled a complaint\u003c/a\u003e against the popular stock trading platform Robinhood for prioritizing “its revenue over the best interest of its customers,” according to documents reviewed by the WSJ.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe deets:\u003c/strong\u003e Regulators argue that Robinhood exposes its customers to “unnecessary trading risks.” Robinhood says its app has “opened up financial markets for a new generation of people who were previously excluded.” They both might be right. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood’s easy-to-navigate platform has attracted over 13 million insanely active traders. In June, it processed 4.3 million daily average revenue trades, more than every other brokerage \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/10/robinhood-reports-more-monthly-trades-than-rivals-charles-schwab-e-trade-combined.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecombined\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the complaint from Massachusetts says that’s exactly the problem. It claims that Robinhood gamifies trading in a way that “encourages customers to use the platform constantly,” without properly conveying the risks associated with betting your net worth on Virgin Galactic call options.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Robinhood, currently valued at $12 billion, is reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/12/08/robinhood-hires-goldman-sachs-to-lead-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeyeing an IPO\u003c/a\u003e in 2021. This MAction could be a sign of legal thumb wars to come. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou could definitely do worse than that sleek toaster from Japanese startup Balmuda, which \u003ca #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent public\u003c/a\u003e on Tokyo’s Mothers exchange yesterday. Shares popped 88% thanks to a flood of enthusiasm from retail investors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eJust like in the states, the number of individual investors in Japan has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/07b2c61b-9d04-459d-8ca0-c509cd636123?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eballooned\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e during the pandemic as people look for ways to fill time that aren’t sourdough or Netflix. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e Balmuda is a small player that offers premium alternatives to the products churned out by Japan’s consumer electronics giants such as Toshiba and Panasonic. That sexy little oven above will set you back $224, and Balmuda’s “The Gohan” rice cooker costs $400. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe toaster isn’t just a pretty face—users \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vogue.com/article/balmuda-toaster?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave said\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e it heats snacks to crispy-on-the-outside, moist-on-the-inside perfection. It comes with a little teaspoon of water, which helps seal in moisture. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThere wasn't a market for high-end toasters until Balmuda showed
